bibl.title: Letter from L.O. Howard to Howard A. Kelly, November 2, 1906

div1.p: Howard sends Kelly copies of two letters from Reed.

div1.head: Letter from L.O. Howard to Howard A. Kelly, November 2, 1906
div1.opener:
Dr Latimer
for Brooklyn
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE,
BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY,
WASHINGTON, D. C.
November 2, 1906.
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY.
Dear Doctor Kelly:
div1.p:
Your card of the 1st has just come. I send you
copies of two letters received from Doctor Reed during the critical
period of the second experiments, the latter one being that mentioned
in my letter of day before yesterday to you. The first one is sent
as an example of Reed's modesty of expression.

It is very kind of you to suggest that you would like to mention
my interest in the work and association with it at the Brooklyn
banquet. Of course I shall be highly pleased if you will do so.
I wish you would look me up some time when you are over here.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, L.o. Howard Dr. Howard A. Kelly,
1418 Utah Place,
Baltimore, Md.
